VLIB_imagePyramid8

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_imagePyramid8 (const uint8_t pIn[restrict], uint16_t inCols, uint16_t inRows, uint8_t pOut[restrict])

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_imagePyramid8 ( const uint8_t  pIn[restrict],
uint16_t  inCols,
uint16_t  inRows,
uint8_t  pOut[restrict] 
)

Description
Calculates Levels 1, 2, and 3 of an image pyramid for an 8-bit input image. The antialiasing filter used at each step is a 2x2 averaging.
Parameters:
[in] pIn[] Input 8-bit input image (UQ8.0)
[in] inCols Input Width of input image (in pixels) (UQ16.0)
[in] inRows Input Height of input image (in pixels) (UQ16.0)
[out] pOut[] Output 8-bit output data (UQ8.0)
Assumptions
  • inCols and inRows both must be a multiple of 8
  • pIn and pOut must be 64-bit aligned
  • pIn is a pointer to an (inCols x inRows) array of unsigned 8 bit data
  • pOut is a pointer to an (inCols x inRows) x 21 / 64 array of unsigned 8 bit data
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
